subject: Investing
title: Cash Dividends vs. Stock Dividends
description: Learn Cash Dividends vs. Stock Dividends in one minute.

hook.text: One company sent you a check for $200. Another gave you 5 extra shares. Both are dividends.

buildup.text: Cash dividends deposit money into your brokerage account. Stock dividends give you additional shares instead.

discovery.text: Cash dividends provide spendable income. Stock dividends increase your share count but dilute per-share value.

twist.text: A stock dividend doesn't create new valueâ€”your ownership slice of the same pie just has more pieces.

climax.text: Income-focused investors prefer cash dividends. Growth-oriented holders may prefer stock or reinvestment.

punchline.text: Cash is income today. Extra shares are a bet on tomorrow.

quiz.question: What is a stock dividend?
options: Additional shares given to shareholders instead of cash
